rows.text_1_facilitator:
Every family faces challenges, but when we work together we can deal with problems in an effective and peaceful way.

What a great skill for your teen to learn too!

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Every family faces challenges, but when we work together we can deal with problems in an effective and peaceful way.

What a great skill for your teen to learn too!

media_transcript.eng:
Greetings, everyone.

Today's topic is problem solving.

We all know that in life there are times where we face problems, and we all know in a way that when we find ourselves in these situations, it is difficult to think of immediate positive solutions.

Therefore, it is important that when we are facing problems we take a pause, we breathe, keep calm and think of problem-solving skills that we may use.

Remember to include our teenagers when we are solving problems. This will help them to become responsible and learn how to solve their own problems in the future.

rows.media_transcript:
Greetings, everyone.

Today's topic is problem solving.

We all know that in life there are times where we face problems, and we all know in a way that when we find ourselves in these situations, it is difficult to think of immediate positive solutions.

Therefore, it is important that when we are facing problems we take a pause, we breathe, keep calm and think of problem-solving skills that we may use.

Remember to include our teenagers when we are solving problems. This will help them to become responsible and learn how to solve their own problems in the future.

media_transcript.eng:
I did not have a good relationship with my daughter. I was always shouting at her, and she was refusing to go to school.

Only when I started spending One-on-One time with her, I realised that she did not want to go to school because she was being bullied at school. We sat down and used the 6 steps of problem solving. We identified the problem, and figured out solutions together: “What can I do as a parent so you can attend school and feel safe?”

We agreed I would go talk to the teacher to find a way forward. We really found the solutions together, and we are closer now.

rows.media_transcript:
I did not have a good relationship with my daughter. I was always shouting at her, and she was refusing to go to school.

Only when I started spending One-on-One time with her, I realised that she did not want to go to school because she was being bullied at school. We sat down and used the 6 steps of problem solving. We identified the problem, and figured out solutions together: “What can I do as a parent so you can attend school and feel safe?”

We agreed I would go talk to the teacher to find a way forward. We really found the solutions together, and we are closer now.

rows.text_1_facilitator: Let’s look at what happened to female_child_name_4 and her female_caregiver_1 when female_child_name_4 got a phone from a boy… can you believe it!

text_1_facilitator.eng: Let’s look at what happened to female_child_name_4 and her female_caregiver_1 when female_child_name_4 got a phone from a boy… can you believe it!

character_1_text.eng: female_child_name_4, where did you get that thing?

character_2_text.eng: male_child_name_2 bought it for me. It’s a nice phone, female_caregiver_1. It takes great photos!

rows.character_1_text: female_child_name_4, where did you get that thing?
rows.character_2_text: male_child_name_2 bought it for me. It’s a nice phone, female_caregiver_1. It takes great photos!

rows.character_1_text: I don’t want to see that expensive thing! That boy is no good! How does he think you are going to repay him for this?!

character_1_text.eng: I don’t want to see that expensive thing! That boy is no good! How does he think you are going to repay him for this?!

character_2_text.eng: That’s not how it works, female_caregiver_1! That’s not fair!

rows.character_2_text: That’s not how it works, female_caregiver_1! That’s not fair!

rows.character_1_text: I do not want to hear it!

character_1_text.eng: I do not want to hear it!

character_2_text.eng: You are not even trying to listen to me! I do not know why I even try with you!

rows.character_2_text: You are not even trying to listen to me! I do not know why I even try with you!

rows.text_1_facilitator:
Here are this week’s takeaway skills!

Take a few deep breaths to calm down, and then try to appraoch the problem using these four steps:

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Here are this week’s takeaway skills!

Take a few deep breaths to calm down, and then try to appraoch the problem using these four steps:

section_2_text.eng: Think of possible solutions and what would happen if we used them.

section_3_text.eng: Choose a solution and try it out.

section_4_text.eng: Did it work? Great! If it did not work, then try another solution.

rows.section_2_text: Think of possible solutions and what would happen if we used them.
rows.section_3_text: Choose a solution and try it out.
rows.section_4_text: Did it work? Great! If it did not work, then try another solution.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
Let’s see how problem solving works in practice.

female_adult_name_7 is coming home from work.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Let’s see how problem solving works in practice.

female_adult_name_7 is coming home from work.

character_1_text.eng: (thinking) Ay my poor feet! I need to sit down a moment and drink a cup of coffee before I start preparing food for everyone.

rows.character_1_text: (thinking) Ay my poor feet! I need to sit down a moment and drink a cup of coffee before I start preparing food for everyone.
male_child_name_1! What are you doing? That bread is for dinner! Now there will not be enough for us all!

character_1_text.eng: male_child_name_1! What are you doing? That bread is for dinner! Now there will not be enough for us all!

rows.character_1_text: Sorry, female_adult_name_8, I was just hungry. I can explain, you see, there is this guy at school...

character_1_text.eng: Sorry, female_adult_name_8, I was just hungry. I can explain, you see, there is this guy at school...

rows.character_1_text: Just give me a moment. I am tired and now worried about having enough food for dinner.

character_1_text.eng: Just give me a moment. I am tired and now worried about having enough food for dinner.

rows.character_1_text: Now tell me, why are you so hungry? Did you not eat your lunch at school?

character_1_text.eng: Now tell me, why are you so hungry? Did you not eat your lunch at school?

character_2_text.eng: That is the problem. There is a guy at school who bullies me. He says if I do not give my lunch to him every day, he and his friends will hurt me. He makes me so mad!

rows.character_2_text: That is the problem. There is a guy at school who bullies me. He says if I do not give my lunch to him every day, he and his friends will hurt me. He makes me so mad!

rows.character_1_text: I am sorry to hear that but am glad that you told me, male_child_name_1. It does not mean that you can eat everybody’s dinner. After we speak, you need to go to the shop to buy some more bread. But first: What do you think we should do about the bully problem?

character_1_text.eng: I am sorry to hear that but am glad that you told me, male_child_name_1. It does not mean that you can eat everybody’s dinner. After we speak, you need to go to the shop to buy some more bread. But first: What do you think we should do about the bully problem?

character_2_text.eng: Well… I want to just hit him or get him back.

rows.character_2_text: Well… I want to just hit him or get him back.

rows.character_1_text: Hmmm… what do you think will happen to you if you do that?

character_1_text.eng: Hmmm… what do you think will happen to you if you do that?

character_2_text.eng: I don’t know. He is bigger than me so he will probably hurt me more. And I could get into trouble at school and expelled.

rows.character_2_text: I don’t know. He is bigger than me so he will probably hurt me more. And I could get into trouble at school and expelled.

rows.character_1_text: Yes, that could happen. What could we do instead?

character_1_text.eng: Yes, that could happen. What could we do instead?

character_2_text.eng: I guess I could tell the teacher. But then the other kids will call me a tattletale. Maybe you could talk to the teacher?

rows.character_2_text: I guess I could tell the teacher. But then the other kids will call me a tattletale. Maybe you could talk to the teacher?

rows.character_1_text: That sounds like a better idea. I could also have a word with his parents if you want me to.

character_1_text.eng: That sounds like a better idea. I could also have a word with his parents if you want me to.

character_2_text.eng: Sure. If you think that would help too. Thanks, Bibi.

rows.character_2_text: Sure. If you think that would help too. Thanks, Bibi.

rows.character_1_text: Anything for you, my dear. I will do it first thing after dinner. And you know? If that does not work, we can always try something else together.

character_1_text.eng: Anything for you, my dear. I will do it first thing after dinner. And you know? If that does not work, we can always try something else together.
How are things going at school now?

character_2_text.eng: It is going better, the boy does not take my lunch anymore. But he is still being really mean to me.

rows.character_1_text: How are things going at school now?
rows.character_2_text: It is going better, the boy does not take my lunch anymore. But he is still being really mean to me.

rows.character_1_text: I am sorry to hear that, male_child_name_1. Shall I ask your uncle to go talk to his parents? If that does not work, we will try something else!

character_1_text.eng: I am sorry to hear that, male_child_name_1. Shall I ask your uncle to go talk to his parents? If that does not work, we will try something else!

character_2_text.eng: Yes, thank you Bibi female_adult_name_7. At least I know you are on my side.

rows.character_2_text: Yes, thank you Bibi female_adult_name_7. At least I know you are on my side.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
Remember female_child_name_4 and the phone she got from the boy? How could female_child_name_4 and female_caregiver_1 use the 4 steps of problem solving, like Bibi female_adult_name_7 and male_child_name_1 did?

KNOW IT - SOLVE IT - TRY IT - TEST IT

Remember female_child_name_4 and the phone she got from the boy? How could female_child_name_4 and female_caregiver_1 use the 4 steps of problem solving, like Bibi female_adult_name_7 and male_child_name_1 did?

KNOW IT - SOLVE IT - TRY IT - TEST IT

rows.quiz_1_option_3_image_asset:
Learn about safe sex:

female_caregiver_1: “This makes me realise we should talk about boyfriends and protecting yourself. Many teens your age get pregnant or become HIV positive. Let’s go to the clinic so you can talk with the nurse to learn how you can stay safe.”
rows.text_1_facilitator: Let’s go back to female_child_name_4 and her female_caregiver_1 and see what solutions they came up with.

text_1_facilitator.eng: Let’s go back to female_child_name_4 and her female_caregiver_1 and see what solutions they came up with.

quiz_1_question.eng: female_child_name_4 and her female_caregiver_1 came up with three solutions. Select each one to see more information

quiz_1_option_1_text.eng:
Ground female_child_name_4 for a month

female_caregiver_1: “You cannot go out for the next month”

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng: That didn’t work... Let's try something else.

quiz_1_option_2_text.eng:
Return the phone and save up. 

female_caregiver_1: "I am not trying to accuse your friend or be jealous. I am worried that when someone gives a gift it is hard to say 'no' when they ask something in return – like sex. If you want to have a phone, we will save up together so you can make your own decisions without owing him anything."

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: This is great! Try the third option as well.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
Parenting teens is really hard.

Often there are no simple and easy solutions, but now female_caregiver_1 learned she can talk to her daughter about these things.

Before, she worried alone, now they can come up with solutions together!

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Parenting teens is really hard.

Often there are no simple and easy solutions, but now female_caregiver_1 learned she can talk to her daughter about these things.

Before, she worried alone, now they can come up with solutions together!

rows.text_1_facilitator:
Teach your teenagers the four steps of problem-solving: KNOW IT - SOLVE IT - TRY IT - TEST IT

Use these steps together when a problem comes up!

When something bad happens, we often get upset and blame. But what our teens really need is someone to help find solutions together. Listen to them, accept how they see and feel things, and thank them for trusting you.

Teaching your teen how to deal with problems will help them for the rest of their lives. What a gift!

Some problems other parents solved with their teens:

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Teach your teenagers the four steps of problem-solving: KNOW IT - SOLVE IT - TRY IT - TEST IT

Use these steps together when a problem comes up!

When something bad happens, we often get upset and blame. But what our teens really need is someone to help find solutions together. Listen to them, accept how they see and feel things, and thank them for trusting you.

Teaching your teen how to deal with problems will help them for the rest of their lives. What a gift!

Some problems other parents solved with their teens:

text_2.eng:
My teenager does not want to go to school
I am worried my teenager will get pregnant or will get someone pregnant
I am worried about what my teen does online
My teenager is hanging out with bad friends
My teenager is lazy
My teenager is not doing their school work
My teenager might be using drugs

media_transcript.eng:
When my father introduced the problem-solving steps to me, it helped me with my family, but it also helped me with my friends.

I told my friends about the steps, and now when we are arguing we sit down and everyone comes up with solutions. We then look for the negatives and positives of each solution, and we agree “okay let’s try this one.”

My friends even took it to their own homes, and it is helping with their families as well!

It is great when others listen to you and accept your ideas even though you are young. We can all bring that harmony with our friends and family.

rows.media_transcript:
When my father introduced the problem-solving steps to me, it helped me with my family, but it also helped me with my friends.

I told my friends about the steps, and now when we are arguing we sit down and everyone comes up with solutions. We then look for the negatives and positives of each solution, and we agree “okay let’s try this one.”

My friends even took it to their own homes, and it is helping with their families as well!

It is great when others listen to you and accept your ideas even though you are young. We can all bring that harmony with our friends and family.
